docs.title: URUS-BEAST DEV FABRIC NETWORK SETUP
docs.text:
FABRIC NETWORK CONFIGURATION:

The configuration specs for the dev fabric network can be found in the sheet – Fabric Network Specs.

NETWORK SETUP:

BAAS-API:

The fabric network setup for beast-dev environment is done using the BAAS-APIs available in https://github.com/chaincodechd/baas/tree/env-in-domain. This documentation will list the sequence of steps followed to onboard each org and the respective payloads used for each API.

ORGANIZATIONS INVOLVED IN THE NETWORK:

The beast-dev network includes the following peer orgs,

  • Org-hospitala with peers – peer0, peer1, peer2 and peer3.
  • Org-hospitalb with peers – peer0, peer1, peer2 and peer3.
  • Org-patients with peers – peer0, peer1, peer2 and peer3 and
  • Org-govtregulator with peers – peer0 and peer1.

And the orderer org,

  • Beast-ordorg with 3 ordering nodes - orderer1, orderer2 and orderer3.

CHANNELS IN THE NETWORK AND THE MEMBERS IN THE CHANNEL:

The network has the following channels,

  • Urus-beast-channel with the members org-hospitala, org-hospitalb, org-patients and org-govtregulator.
  • Beast-hospitala-channel with the members org-hospitala, org-patients and org-govtregulator.
  • Beast-hospitalb-channel with the members org-hospitalb, org-patients and org-govtregulator.

ONBOARDING ORGS USING BAAS-API:

Following will list the sequence of steps followed to onboard the orderer and peer orgs, create channels and the payloads passed for each API request.

1) ORDERER ORG DEPLOYMENT:

PAYLOAD: 

{ 
    "orgName": "beast-ordorg", 
    "count": 3, 
    "maxMessageCount": 10, 
    "absoluteMaxBytes": 103809024, 
    "preferredMaxBytes": 524288, 
    "channelName": "system-channel", 
    "domain": "urusbeast.com" 
}
